results.title: The Bomb
results.creator_credit: Pat Ryan, Eltham Films and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: A satirical puppet films for children dealing with modern diplomacy. Two opposing embassies, anxious to obtain a nihilistic bomb, emply agents, one being Sebastian the Fox (a puppet). While the diplomats are greedily absorbed with the results they hope to achieve through possession of the bomb, Sebastian removes it. With Bruce Anderson, Lialianne Horschnad, Tom Sanders and Stephen Murray-Smith. Music by George Drefus, puppeteer Janet Van Puffelen.

results.title: The Bolshoi Theatre: 200th season
results.brief_description: First established in 1776 in Moscow, the Boilshoi Theatre has hosted 200 annual seasons of ballet and opera. This documentary celebrates the history and nostalgia of this wonderful Russian theatre in its 200th season with excerpts from several ballets and operas, along with archival stills, newsreels and commentary. Credits in Russian with English narration.

results.title: The Bolshoi Ballet in the Park
results.creator_credit: Colin Nears, Entertainment Corporation Concerts and Arts, BBC-TV, National Video Corporation and John Vernon
results.brief_description: This spectacular performance by the artists of the Bolshoi Ballet took place at the Battersea Pavilion, London in 1986 with The Orchestra of London conducted by Alexander Kopylov and artistic direction and choreography by Yuri Grigorovich. The program consisted of: 1. Les Sylphides (Chopin) - Natalia Bessmertnova, Lyudmila Semenyaka, Nina Semizorova, Alexei Fadeyechev. 2. Spartacus Act II (Khachaturian) - Eric Moukhamedov, Natalia Bessmertnova, Alexei Lazaryev, Alla Mikhalchenko. 3. Sleeping beauty (Tchaikovsky) pas de deux - Nina Araniashvili, Leonid Nikonov. 4. La Bayadere (Minkus) solo - Mikhail Tsivin. 5. Swan lake (Tchaikovsky) pas de deux - Nina Semizorova, Alexei Fadeyechev. 6. The Golden age (Shostakovich) - Natalia Bessmertnova, Erik Moukhamedov. 7. Spring waters (Rachmaninov) - Maria Bylova, Leonid Nikonov. Don Quixote (Minkus) - Lyudmila Semenyaka, Yuri Vasyuchenko, Tatiana Bessmertnova, Tatiana Golikova.

results.title: The Bolero [Ed. version]
results.creator_credit: Allan Miller Productions and Allan Miller
results.brief_description: An exciting study of Ravel’s composition “Bolero” with the subtle meanings and accents polished to a brilliant interpretation by members of the Los Angeles Philharmonic Orchestra with Zubin Mehta. The film involves the viewer in each musician’s approach to his part in individual preparation and general rehearsals prior to the final performance. It also gives some insight into Mehta’s perspective on musical values in the composition. (An edited version of Title 001358)

results.title: The Bohemian girl
results.creator_credit: Hal Roach, James W. Horne and Charles Rogers
results.brief_description: A tale of gypsies who kidnap a nobleman’s daughter and bring her up as their own. When they return years later, the girl is wrongly blamed for stealing from her father’s house. Based on the operetta by Balfe, this comedy adaptation stars Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy with Thelma Todd, Antonio Moreno, Jacqueline Wells, James Finlayson.

results.title: The Bodyworkers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Healers quacks or mystics”.
Bodyworkers use a range of techniques to release tension and anxiety in the body in order to release energy for life and healing. Bodyworkers believe the body holds secrets for our health and that our society’s over-emphasis on the mind, destroys the important mind/body balance. Techniques demonstrated include massage, the Alexander technique for improving posture, Rolfing (developed by US biologist, Dr. Ida Rolf) and Wilhelm Reich’s theories of sexual energy and release.

results.title: The Body snatcher
results.creator_credit: Val Lewton, RKO Radio Pictures and Robert Wise
results.brief_description: Atmospheric horror film based on a Robert Louis Stevenson short story. Set in Edinburgh of 1831, a gifted doctor who runs a medical school is haunted by a grave robber who supplied corpses to research scientists and once protected him from a prison term. Cast includes Boris Karloff, Bela Lugosi and Henry Daniell.

results.title: The Body Malleable
results.material_description: video, interactive software, mixed media, colour and sound
results.brief_description: The Body Malleable is an intimate interactive work where a custom built ‘gromit’ is physically engaged with by the viewer to create a display combining digital animation and synchronised audio in the installation space. The custom interface, placed on a desk for one viewer to interact with at a time, is internally configured with a 100 key keyboard broken up and reassembled within the spherical space. Darkness within the pod, the viewer is asked to insert their finger into a small opening to probe the key board lining. The keys pressed act as switches to key events programmed into Director and thus set off a series of audio-visual responses via surround sound and a single circular screen projection to create an intimate experiential space determined by the audiences interaction.

results.title: The Body in the library
results.creator_credit: Guy Slater, Silvio Narizzano and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Miss Marple Series”.
This Agatha Christie story is set in the deceptively sleepy English village of St Mary Mead during the late 1940s. One morning Colonel and Mrs Bantry awake to discover the corpse of an unknown platinum blonde on the hearthrug in their library. Mrs Bantry turns to her neighbour, Jane Marple, who comes at once to investigate, with the constabulary close on her heels. The police follow their official lines of inquiry, but Miss Marple has her own idea. Her instincts warn her that another disaster is close at hand, and when she is proved right she sets out to trap the ruthless double murderer.
